column4: How can I start gnome apps - such as evince- over a ssh -CX connection? Since Intrepid, those apps keep complaining about gconf is not running....
hmm.. never had any problems before.. hang on.. let me try it locally here
seems about a problem with dbus.
I just tried running mousepad, since I run xfce on the remote computer and that worked nicely..
might be a gnome thing though..
yes, for sure. xfce apps won't complain about gconf
as I now see that you wrote in your question =)
let me boot up my laptop then.. it has plain ubuntu/gnome on it
my concern is that gconf needs to be properly launched with dbus somewhat, since latest gnome release.
also may be a problem of Gnome already running in the remote machine. I'll check that right now.
it seems to work alright for me.. I get an error "Failed to create dbus proxu for org.gnome.Settings".. but it still works
hmm, but in my case works very slow at certain operations like showing a file-browser dialog, etc.
well... it isn't very fast.. but it's still usable I think
yes, just I wish to find out which is the proper way to do remote use of current gnome apps...
strange, I've found out how to start dbus manually and "attach" gconf to it, and now I get the error you shown me.... and works much better. Your laptop is in Intrepid?
